Montevideo Public Schools Families and Staff,

On Friday afternoon, we were notified that a staff member at Montevideo High School and a staff member at the Sanford Education Center tested positive for COVID-19, with exposure date(s) of 8/24 and 8/25.

We have been working with the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and Countryside Public Health to identify those who had close contact with the case and have communicated with them individually. The risk of exposure for other individuals present in the buildings on those dates is no greater than the risk of contracting the virus in the general community.

We understand that this may create unease in our community. We have taken action to clean and sanitize the facility and are working closely with MDH to monitor the situation. Please be assured that Montevideo Public Schools are following all of the guidelines issued by the CDC, the Minnesota Department of Health and Countryside Public Health as we work to help keep our school and community safe.

Sincerely,
Luther L Heller, Superintendent of Schools

He empowered our youth to rise up with confidence and persevere through each of their own unique challenges. Our students left the gym with a renewed sense of self-worth. This experience was incredible.

Ask your student, “Do you remember that day in January when Cory Greenwood spoke to your school?” Or, ask them what they remembered about his presentation.

Mr. Greenwood made a short video for our Thunder Hawk Seniors.

Over the last two Fridays, the MMS Band students have been busy giving performances for their families, neighbors, friends, and pets. They were to remind families and neighbors that music can still be shared. Music helps bring peace, healing and joy. Music connects us in this time of separation.

This is a project being done around the country, so there are students all around the country who have been participating in what the music education community is calling "Porch Concerts". What an awesome way to connect to other musicians and people when we feel so separated!

In honor of our concert day today, please enjoy this picture collage of our MMS students sharing their music! We wish we were actually performing for you! #MusicConnectsUs

In honor of our concert day today, please enjoy this picture collage of our MMS students sharing their music! We wish we were actually performing for you! #MusicConnectsUs

Here are 3 quick, simple, mindful games you can get your children involved in without much preparation, time, and hassle:

-Touch: Put a bunch of mystery items in a paper bag and take turns feeling one object at a time and guess what it is as you describe the texture and shape.
-Sight: Look around the room in silence for one minute, and point out all of the things you never noticed before.
-Sound: Set a timer for one minute and count how many different sounds you can hear with your eyes closed, and then share what you heard with each other.
